alert.note: Alert for Baker; Ben Hill; Dougherty; Irwin; Lee; Tift; Turner; Worth (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 05 at 3:46PM EDT until April 05 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Irwin County in south central Georgia... Dougherty County in southwestern Georgia... Turner County in south central Georgia... Central Lee County in southwestern Georgia... Northeastern Baker County in southwestern Georgia... Northwestern Tift County in south central Georgia... Western Ben Hill County in south central Georgia... Worth County in south central Georgia... * Until 445 PM EDT. * At 346 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Cordele to 8 miles northwest of Baconton, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Albany, Ashburn, Sylvester, Putney, Leesburg, Fitzgerald, Poulan, Ty Ty, East Albany, Marine Corps Logistics Base, Turner City, Walker, Worth, Terrell, Sycamore, Sumner, Warwick, Rebecca, Stocks and Radium Springs. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for south central and southwestern Georgia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms may cause serious injury and significant property damage. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for south central and southwestern Georgia.
